required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Program Evaluation: Eggs Hatching Hope. Providing Egg Vouchers to Women With Young Children in Rural Honduras.

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a prospective community-cluster non-randomized trial that will evaluate the effectiveness of a program that will provide 30-day egg vouchers to mothers of 6 to 24 month-old children living in rural areas of Intibucá, Honduras.

study_design_info.masking_description: The principal investigator and statistician will be blinded to the treatment group.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Length/Height-for-age z-scores (zHAZ) from baseline at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Calculated using the 2006 World Health Organization Child Growth Standards

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Length/Height-for-age z-scores (zHAZ) from baseline at 12 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline zHAZ at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Calculated using the 2006 World Health Organization Child Growth Standards

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the prevalence of stunting from baseline at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated using the 2006 World Health Organization Child Growth Standards (zHAZ <-2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the prevalence of stunting from baseline at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated using the 2006 World Health Organization Child Growth Standards (zHAZ <-2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the prelavence of underweight (Weight-for-age z-score <-2) from baseline at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated using the 2006 World Health Organization Child Growth Standards

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the prelavence of underweight (Weight-for-age z-score <-2) from baseline at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated using the 2006 World Health Organization Child Growth Standards

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of rapid weight gain after 6 months of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as a zBMI upward percentile crossing (>+0.67 SD) Calculated using the 2006 World Health Organization Child Growth Standards

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of rapid weight gain after 12 months of intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as a zBMI upward percentile crossing (>+0.67 SD) Calculated using the 2006 World Health Organization Child Growth Standards

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the prevalence of diarrhea from baseline at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as three or more liquid or semisolid stools in 24 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the prevalence of Respiratory symptoms from baseline at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as reported presence of cough, or nasal congestion, or ear ache, or sore throat in the last 7 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the prevalence of Respiratory infections from baseline at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as reported presence of fever + any of the following symptoms: cough, or nasal congestion, or ear ache, or sore throat in the last 7 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the food insecurity scores from baseline at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the 2012 Latin American and Caribbean scale of Food insecurity (Escala Latinoamercana y Caribeña de Seguridad Alimentaria)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the food insecurity scores from baseline at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the 2012 Latin American and Caribbean scale of Food insecurity (Escala Latinoamercana y Caribeña de Seguridad Alimentaria)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the dietary diversity scores from baseline at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the frequency of intake survey from the 2012 Latin American and Caribbean scale of Food insecurity (Escala Latinoamercana y Caribeña de Seguridad Alimentaria)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the dietary diversity scores from baseline at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using the frequency of intake survey from the 2012 Latin American and Caribbean scale of Food insecurity (Escala Latinoamercana y Caribeña de Seguridad Alimentaria)

arm_group.description: 30-day egg vouchers, in addition to the standard of care.

intervention.description: 30-day egg vouchers will be provided monthly, in addition to standard of care.
Participants will continue to receive the standard of care. No egg vouchers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy children ages 6 to 24 months at the time the study begins
- No cerebral palsy, birth defect or condition that may affect their growth or development.
- Children living in the department of Intibucá, Honduras
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children from families that are considering leaving the region within the next 12 months
- Known egg allergy

facility.name: Clinica medica Roy and Melaney Sanders
